meanings.sent1: The swarthy man had a deep tan from working outside all summer.
meanings.sent2: She admired the swarthy complexion of her friend who had just returned from a tropical vacation.
meanings.sent3: The swarthy beachgoer joked that he was so tanned, he blended in with the sand.
meanings.sent4: The old leather jacket had a swarthy hue, reminiscent of a well-traveled explorer.
meanings.sent5: The swarthy color of the wooden table reminded her of rich mahogany.

meanings.definition: Having a dark or dusky skin color.
meanings.sent1: The swarthy pirate's face was weathered from years at sea.
meanings.sent2: In the dim light, his swarthy complexion gave him a mysterious aura.
meanings.sent3: The swarthy detective blended into the shadows, making him an excellent spy.
meanings.sent4: Her swarthy hair contrasted beautifully with her bright blue eyes.
meanings.sent5: The swarthy clouds signaled an impending storm.
